intro: Sisymbrium versicolor, commonly known as the variable mustard, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is characterized by its variable leaf shapes and colorful flowers that range from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Sisymbrium versicolor is an annual plant that blooms from spring to early summer.
